Constructor Detail

Threads

public Threads()
Method Detail

getAvailableProcessors

public static int getAvailableProcessors()
Gets the number of available processors (cores).

Returns:
the number of available processors (cores).

makeArray

public static java.lang.Thread[] makeArray()
Returns a new array for threads. The length of the array equals the number of available processors (or cores).

Note that this method does not actually construct any threads.

Returns:
the array.

makeArray

public static java.lang.Thread[] makeArray(double multiple)
Returns a new array for threads. The length of the array is greater than zero and is proportional to the number of available processors (or cores).

Note that this method does not actually construct any threads.

Parameters:
multiple - desired number of threads per processor (or core).
Returns:
the array, with length for at least one thread.

startAndJoin

public static void startAndJoin(java.lang.Thread[] threads)
Starts and joins all threads in the specified array.

Parameters:
threads - array of threads.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if any threads are interrupted.
